comment: Phenomenal woman/professor yet hard to get in contact with.  Grading process leaves a lot to be desired (Errors on exams never fixed to reflect proper score via D2L).  Seldom updates on assignment/book grades throughout semester; hard to track progress.  Good speaker with good on the spot feedback.

Professor Hall is a really good person with a good heart, but her teaching methods aren't that great. Her tests are excruciatingly hard, even with the use of the textbook, and she rarely keeps her students updated about the grades that they currently have in the class. Regardless, she's a good person and she does seem to care about her students.

Just  bad.  You won't learn anything in class.  Talk and get off topic.  Test are hard because you literally have to read every page in the book.  You still went be able to answer some of the questions on test.  I really don't understand why she teach. She puts more time in her other job than teaching.

She is a great teacher and treats everyone the same.If you are the type of person to slack on your work, then she will check you.She is straight forward, to the point and will tolerate nonsense.All high school behavior stay home.

Funny thing.."EXPOUNDER" is one of Kay Hall's favorite words in the dictionary!  I would venture to say easily that her only positive comments found in this link are directly from her mouth!  GUARANTEED WORST TEACHER AT KSU!!!

Professor Hall was great expounder on the topic of communication.  She is also a no nonsense professional who expects students as adults to be accountable and responsible. Overall I enjoyed her class, challenges and found her to be a wealth of knowledge.  Her exams were a bit tough though.

Even though I received a good grade in this class, I think it should be said that she is unprofessional, lacks communication skills, impossible to get in touch with and ridiculously hard when the material doesn't warrant this.She teaches with a chip on her shoulder and the worst part is that i learned absolutely nothing. Waste of money and time.

This person is a perfect example of a person who puts through little effort in her part time job-in this case a person who wields power over student grades. Everyone can read their books and take tests, that is what on line classes are for-and don't ask the Comm chair for help-equally useless!

I throughly enjoyed Ms. Hall's class. If you do the work she will reward you with a good grade.  If you have any problems that may effect you grade let her know and she will work with you. DO NOT ACT LIKE YOU ARE STILL IN HIGH SCHOOL SHE IS QUICK TO TELL YOU THAT YOU ARE NOT.

Worst teacher ever.  KSU says that is cares what its students think.  I wrote a horrible review at the end of the semester, like most (2 yrs. ago) and she is still at KSU.  She doesn't teach, group work whole class.  Tests are not what is covered in class.  She is soooo lazy.  KSU needs to pay attn. to what students are saying.  Worst teacher ever.

Complete waste of time!!! I got A, but I was extremely disappointed.She lets you know what is gonna be on the test, but because you've never actually discussed the material it's hard to know which answer is correct, because the textbook she is using is as horrible as she is. Don't take this class unless you are just looking for a credit.

DO NOT TAKE this teacher!!!  She does not go over what's in the book.  We are responsible for reading and knowing everything.  What good is it to have a teacher in class if we ourselves are the teachers.  She gets paid to sit there & do nothing, for that we might as well take the class over the internet.  She is a nice lady but a HORRIBLE TEACHER!
terrible
I actually looked forward to this class prior to getting this prof.  I think I will take the class again, with another professor, just so I might learn something.

The tests are straight from the book, and according to her are created by the book publisher. There is NO lecturing. This making learning difficult; however, all COMM 1109 classes are "group learning style."  Except for that, she is a nice person, not an excellent teacher. REMEMBER TO READ YOUR SYLLABUS CAREFULLY!

Ms Hall should not be teaching something she knows nothing about!  She says you can communicate to her but I have yet to see her send an email back to anyone.  She gives out a number to call in the syllabus, but she never calls anyone back.  Horrible professor!  I would say practice what you preach, but she doesn't even to that!
The class shows you what college is all about.  Ms. Hall is very straight and forward, but also prepares you for the future.  She's the greatest!

Extremely unprofessional!  Calls students losers in class, humilates students in front of the class if they don't understand something!  On her test the questions and answers are all based off her own opinions and not what in the book! Why do we even read the book?  Never teaches anything, just puts you in groups all day and u figure it out!
Poor....she doesn't give clear direction and tends to contradict herself.

Ms Hall is a difficult teacher.  You MUST get your book for her class. She makes you read every chapter. Part of the material on her test are things that you never go over.  She likes to do group projects in almost every class. And attendance is MANDATORY!!! If you want an A in this class, do not take Ms Hall.

Ironic that she teaches COMMUNICATION considering she can't form a sentence 1/2 the time. The tests are multiple choice with more than 1 right answer-she says pick "the best" right answer. I'm an A student and I'm struggling to maintain a B. She passes out worksheets for every class instead of talking about the reading.She seems nice, BAD PROF.

I can't believe the department allowed her to get away with claiming to be a Professor. She is very blunt, critical,arrogant, and defensive. When it comes to her personal life, she is an open book. The lesson has absolutely nothing to do with the Exams. She is condescending and if you don't read minds, don't take this class!! This lady needs to see

She's friendly sure, but her arrogance kills that for ya quick. You won't learn anything, because she can't teach - so you'll stay confused! You'll be totally reliant upon your book, and be prepared to study harder than you ever have for a C on her very evasive and misleading tests. If you care about your GPA... Stay Away!

Hard to communicate with. Seems to pick favorites. Changes subjects constantly with not much time to slow down. Strict on attendence. Seemed to be a nice person, but not a great teacher. Dropped early.

She's horrible! She seems to hate teaching/ students-Whenever you ask her a question she makes you look like a complete idiot-Her tests have nothing to do with what she teaches in class-She has a strict attendance poilcy-If she finishes teaching early she'll keep you class until the whole hour and 15 mins have been used! 7 people withdrew out of 28
Nice lady, HORRIBLE teacher

She's a first year teacher & there is a total lack of communication between student and teacher. I did not learn a single thing in her classroom. Her tests are horrible because she doesn't cover a single thing on them. All in all, not a good teacher. Avoid her, if possible!
